/cluster/vips get post

get

Retrieve the list of virtual IP addresses. Includes the IP and FQDN for each, along with current status.

post

Create new virtual IP addresses.

get /cluster/vips

Retrieve the list of virtual IP addresses. Includes the IP and FQDN for each, along with current status.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

The list of virtual IP addresses was retrieved successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "vips": {
      "description": "A list of all virtual IP addresses in the Log Insight cluster",
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "uuid": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "ipAddress": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "fqdn": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "tags": {
            "type": "object",
            "additionalProperties": {
              "type":"string"
            }
          },
          "status": {
            "enum": [
              "AVAILABLE",
              "UNAVAILABLE",
              "UNKNOWN"
            ]
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "vips": [
    {
      "uuid": "10.11.12.13",
      "ipAddress": "10.11.12.13",
      "fqdn": "test1.example.com",
      "tags": {
        "k1": "v1",
        "k2": "v2"
       },
      "status": "AVAILABLE"
    },
    {
      "uuid": "10.11.12.14",
      "ipAddress": "10.11.12.14",
      "fqdn": "",
      "tags": {
        "k3": "v3"
       },
      "status": "UNAVAILABLE"
    },
    {
      "uuid": "10.11.12.15",
      "ipAddress": "10.11.12.15",
      "fqdn": "test3.example.com",
      "tags": "key3=val3",
      "tags": {
         "k4": "v4",
         "k5": "v5"
       },
      "status": "UNKNOWN"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /cluster/vips

Create new virtual IP addresses.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "ipAddress": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "fqdn": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "tags": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": {
        "type":"string"
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "ipAddress"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "ipAddress": "10.11.12.13",
  "fqdn": "test1.example.com",
  "tags": {
    "k1": "v1",
    "k2": "v2"
   }
}

HTTP status code 200

New virtual IP address was created successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "uuid": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "uuid": "10.11.12.13"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

A virtual IP address with specified IP Address or FQDN already exists.

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/cluster/vips/{uuid} get put delete

get

Retrieve the details of a virtual IP address. Includes the IP and FQDN for each, along with current status.

put

Update existing virtual IP address.

delete

Delete specified virtual IP address.

get /cluster/vips/{uuid}

Retrieve the details of a virtual IP address. Includes the IP and FQDN for each, along with current status.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • uuid: required (string)

    This is a unique ID for Log Insight virtual IP address. It can be retrieved by 'GET /cluster/vips' call.

HTTP status code 200

The virtual IP address details were retrieved successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "uuid": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "ipAddress": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "fqdn": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "tags": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": {
        "type":"string"
      }
    },
    "status": {
      "enum": [
        "AVAILABLE",
        "UNAVAILABLE",
        "UNKNOWN"
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "uuid": "10.11.12.13",
  "ipAddress": "10.11.12.13",
  "fqdn": "test1.example.com",
  "tags": {
    "k1": "v1",
    "k2": "v2"
   },
  "status": "AVAILABLE"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 404

A virtual IP address with specified UUID was not found.

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Type: application/json

  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",

    "fqdn": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "tags": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": {
        "type":"string"
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

  "tags": {
    "k1": "v1",
    "k2": "v2"
   }
}

The virtual IP address was updated successfully.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Security

URI Parameters

  • uuid: required (string)

    This is a unique ID for Log Insight virtual IP address. It can be retrieved by 'GET /cluster/vips' call.

HTTP status code 200

The specified Virtual IP address was deleted successfully.

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 404

A virtual IP address with the specified UUID was not found.

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/config

/config/data get post

get

Export LogInsight configuration into a file, which can be used for configuring a fresh Log Insight setup.

Exported configuration includes the following information about the LogInsight cluster:

  • General configuration (CEIP, System notification recipients, etc.)
  • NTP configuration
  • Event forwarder configuration
  • SMTP configuration
  • Archiving settings
  • Agents groups configuration

Exported configuration does NOT include the following information:

  • Cluster configuration (e.g. the number of nodes, VIP configuration, etc.) Exporting VIP configuration might result in multiple clusters having the same VIP, which would cause isues with ingestion, event forwarding, etc.
  • Hosts information
  • Patterns and fields extracted during machine learning
  • Agents configuration
  • Local users. Local users aren't migrated for security reasons so that passwords are exposed in the exported configuration file.
  • Active Directory and vIDM configurations aren't migrated for security reasons, as exporting these configurations would expose the passwords.
  • Content packs and user content, such as dashboards, alerts, etc. Content migration can be addressed with separate APIs designed to export and import content packs and user content.
  • SSL configuration
  • vSphere integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
  • vROps integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
post

Import an exported Log Insight configuration.

The following configuration can be imported based on the provided parameters:

  • General configuration (CEIP, System notification recipients, etc.)
  • NTP configuration
  • Event forwarder configuration
  • SMTP configuration
  • Archiving settings
  • Agents groups configuration

Imported configuration does NOT include the following information:

  • Cluster configuration (e.g. the number of nodes, VIP configuration, etc.) Exporting VIP configuration might result in multiple clusters having the same VIP, which would cause isues with ingestion, event forwarding, etc.
  • Hosts information
  • Patterns and fields extracted during machine learning
  • Agents configuration
  • Local users. Local users aren't migrated for security reasons so that passwords are exposed in the exported configuration file.
  • Active Directory and vIDM configurations aren't migrated for security reasons, as exporting these configurations would expose the passwords.
  • Content packs and user content, such as dashboards, alerts, etc. Content migration can be addressed with separate APIs designed to export and import content packs and user content.
  • SSL configuration
  • vSphere integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
  • vROps integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.

Configuration import process consists of two steps:

  1. The exported configuration file should be uploaded as binary data with the "Content-Type: applications/octet-stream" header.
  2. Once the file is uploaded, the configurations can be applied by setting the "Content-Type: applications/json" header and providing the items to exclude in the JSON body.

get /config/data

Export LogInsight configuration into a file, which can be used for configuring a fresh Log Insight setup.

Exported configuration includes the following information about the LogInsight cluster:

  • General configuration (CEIP, System notification recipients, etc.)
  • NTP configuration
  • Event forwarder configuration
  • SMTP configuration
  • Archiving settings
  • Agents groups configuration

Exported configuration does NOT include the following information:

  • Cluster configuration (e.g. the number of nodes, VIP configuration, etc.) Exporting VIP configuration might result in multiple clusters having the same VIP, which would cause isues with ingestion, event forwarding, etc.
  • Hosts information
  • Patterns and fields extracted during machine learning
  • Agents configuration
  • Local users. Local users aren't migrated for security reasons so that passwords are exposed in the exported configuration file.
  • Active Directory and vIDM configurations aren't migrated for security reasons, as exporting these configurations would expose the passwords.
  • Content packs and user content, such as dashboards, alerts, etc. Content migration can be addressed with separate APIs designed to export and import content packs and user content.
  • SSL configuration
  • vSphere integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
  • vROps integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Returns a file containing the exported configuration.

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /config/data

Import an exported Log Insight configuration.

The following configuration can be imported based on the provided parameters:

  • General configuration (CEIP, System notification recipients, etc.)
  • NTP configuration
  • Event forwarder configuration
  • SMTP configuration
  • Archiving settings
  • Agents groups configuration

Imported configuration does NOT include the following information:

  • Cluster configuration (e.g. the number of nodes, VIP configuration, etc.) Exporting VIP configuration might result in multiple clusters having the same VIP, which would cause isues with ingestion, event forwarding, etc.
  • Hosts information
  • Patterns and fields extracted during machine learning
  • Agents configuration
  • Local users. Local users aren't migrated for security reasons so that passwords are exposed in the exported configuration file.
  • Active Directory and vIDM configurations aren't migrated for security reasons, as exporting these configurations would expose the passwords.
  • Content packs and user content, such as dashboards, alerts, etc. Content migration can be addressed with separate APIs designed to export and import content packs and user content.
  • SSL configuration
  • vSphere integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.
  • vROps integration configuration isn't migrated for security reasons, as exporting this configuration would expose the passwords.

Configuration import process consists of two steps:

  1. The exported configuration file should be uploaded as binary data with the "Content-Type: applications/octet-stream" header.
  2. Once the file is uploaded, the configurations can be applied by setting the "Content-Type: applications/json" header and providing the items to exclude in the JSON body.
Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "includeGeneralConfig": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "includeNtpConfig": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "includeEventForwarderConfig": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "includeSmtpConfig": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "includeArchivingConfig": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "includeAgentsGroups": {
      "type": "boolean"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "includeNtpConfig": "false",
  "includeAgentsGroups": "false"
}

HTTP status code 200

Imports the configuration file and applies the selected configuration.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "GeneralConfiguration": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "Time": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "EventForwarder": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "SMTP": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "Archiving": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "SSL": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "includeAgentsGroups": {
    "type": "string"
  }
}

Example:

{
    "GeneralConfiguration": "Successfully configured.",
    "Time": "Successfully configured.",
    "EventForwarder": "Successfully configured.",
    "SMTP": "Successfully configured.",
    "Archiving": "Successfully configured.",
    "includeAgentsGroups": "Successfully configured."
}

HTTP status code 202

Applying the imported configuration has partially succeeded.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "GeneralConfiguration": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "Time": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "EventForwarder": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "SMTP": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "Archiving": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "SSL": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "includeAgentsGroups": {
    "type": "string"
  }
}

Example:

{
    "GeneralConfiguration": "Successfully configured.",
    "Time": "Successfully configured.",
    "EventForwarder": "Successfully configured.",
    "SMTP": "Successfully configured.",
    "Archiving": "Successfully configured.",
    "includeAgentsGroups": "Successfully configured."
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Example:

  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Group URL for content packs, user content and shared content

Group URL for providing APIs to work with content packs, user content and shared content

/content/contentpack post

post

Install a content pack

post /content/contentpack

Install a content pack

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • overwrite: (boolean - default: false)

    Overwrite already installed content pack

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "icon": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example",
  "icon": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 200

The installed content pack json representation

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"

            "type": "string"

          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {

          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"

          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"

          "chartQuery": {

            "type": "string"

          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"

        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"

              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "version",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

The request was refused because the user doesn't have enough permissions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 409

Returning already existing content pack with provided namespace

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "version",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }

  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",

      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",

    }

  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],

  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",

  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/contentpack/list get

get

Returns the list of all installed content packs' meta information

get /content/contentpack/list

Returns the list of all installed content packs' meta information

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Returns the list of all installed content packs. List contains content pack metadata like name, namespace, version etc.. "formatVersion" property shows the minimum version of Log Insight that is 100% compatible with the version of content pack. "contentVersion" shows the version of content pack. "framework" property shows hexadecimal representation of content pack framework version calculated as: (lowest compatible version * 1000, eg. v1.5 * 1000 = 1500). If a content pack has a framework value > than Log Insight content pack framework version * 1000, the pack cannot be imported.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "contentPackMetadataList": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "namespace": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "formatVersion": {
            "description": "The minimum version of Log Insight that is 100% compatible with the version of content pack",
            "type": "string"
          },
          "contentVersion": {
            "description": "The version of the content pack",
            "type": "string"
          },
          "author": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "url": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "instructions": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "upgradeInstructions": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "framework": {
            "description": "Hexadecimal representation of content pack framework version calculated as: (lowest compatible version * 1000, eg. v1.5 * 1000 = 1500). If a content pack has a framework value > than Log Insight content pack framework version * 1000, the pack cannot be imported.",
            "type": "string"
          },
          "iconUrl": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "namespace"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "contentPackMetadataList"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "contentPackMetadataList": [
    {
      "name": "VMware - vSphere",
      "namespace": "com.vmware.vsphere",
      "formatVersion": "2.4",
      "contentVersion": "4.0",
      "author": "VMware, Inc.",
      "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
      "info": "Example",
      "instructions": "Example",
      "upgradeInstructions": "Example",
      "framework": "#9c4"
    },
    {
      "name": "General",
      "namespace": "com.vmware.loginsight.general",
      "formatVersion": "2.0",
      "contentVersion": "2.5",
      "author": "VMware, Inc.",
      "url": "http://www.vmware.com",
      "info": "Example",
      "framework": "#5dc"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/contentpack/{contentPackNamespace} get delete

get

Export an installed content pack with provided namespace

delete

Delete installed content pack with provided namespace

get /content/contentpack/{contentPackNamespace}

Export an installed content pack with provided namespace

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • contentPackNamespace: required (string)

    Namespace is a unique identifier of the requested content pack

HTTP status code 200

Content Pack with provided namespace

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"

            "type": "string"

      "type": "array",

      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"

      "type": "array",

      "type": "array"

      "type": "array"

    "version",

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",

                  "messageQuery": "{}"

          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 404

Not found.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Not Found

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

delete /content/contentpack/{contentPackNamespace}

Delete installed content pack with provided namespace

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • contentPackNamespace: required (string)

    Namespace is a unique identifier of the requested content pack

HTTP status code 200

Item successfully deleted

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: text/plain

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

The request was refused because the user doesn't have enough permissions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 404

Not found.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Not Found

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/usercontent post get

post

Import to "My Content". Importing only dashboards, bookmarked queries, alerts and extracted fields.

get

Export all user content as a content pack

post /content/usercontent

Import to "My Content". Importing only dashboards, bookmarked queries, alerts and extracted fields.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "icon": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example",
  "icon": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 200

Get imported contect pack

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"

    "framework": {
      "type": "string"

    },

      "type": "string"

    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",

      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",

      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

The request was refused because the user doesn't have enough permissions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }

  "required": [
    "errorMessage"

}

  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
