Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

get /content/usercontent

Export all user content as a content pack

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • namespace: required (string)

    Namespace is a unique identifier required for creating a content pack based on the user content, e.g. com.company.product

HTTP status code 200

Content pack containing all user content.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "version",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/usercontent/{userId} get post

get

Export all user content of specified user as a content pack

post

Import to "My Content" of specified user

get /content/usercontent/{userId}

Export all user content of specified user as a content pack

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The ID of user, whose content is migrated. The list of all user IDs can be retrieved using Get users

Query Parameters

  • namespace: required (string)

    Namespace is a unique identifier required for creating a content pack based on the user content, e.g. com.company.product

HTTP status code 200

Content pack containing all user content of specified user.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"

          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"

          "options": {
            "type": "string"

        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"

          "info": {
            "type": "string"

          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"

          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"

          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"

          "views": {

    "namespace",
    "version",
    "contentVersion"

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

The request was refused because the user doesn't have enough permissions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 404

Not found.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Not Found

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /content/usercontent/{userId}

Import to "My Content" of specified user

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Secured by Bearer

    The ID of user, whose content is migrated. The list of all user IDs can be retrieved using Get users

HTTP status code 200

Get imported contect pack

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

The request was refused because the user doesn't have enough permissions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 404

Not found.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Not Found

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/usercontent/dashboard

User dashboards group URL

/content/usercontent/dashboard/list get

get

Returns the list of all dashboards meta information from "My Content", e.g. name, ID

get /content/usercontent/dashboard/list

Returns the list of all dashboards meta information from "My Content", e.g. name, ID

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

List of all dashboard names and IDs

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "dashboards": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "id"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "dashboards"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "dashboards":[
    {
      "name":"example1",
      "id":"1"
    },
    {
      "name":"example2",
      "id":"2"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Type: text/plain

Example:

Schema:

  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]

Example:

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/usercontent/dashboard/{dashboardId} delete

delete

Remove dashboard from "My Content"

delete /content/usercontent/dashboard/{dashboardId}

Remove dashboard from "My Content"

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • dashboardId: required (string)

    The dashboard ID. The list of available dashbord IDs can be retrieved using Get user dashboards

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "bookmarkedQueries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "id"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "bookmarkedQueries"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "bookmarkedQueries":[
    {
      "name":"example1",
      "id":"b64075a2-ae27-4606-9d7f-fb7eae0b4147"
    },
    {
      "name":"example2",
      "id":"191ddaa3-4d47-4bb8-8205-6c8ea286fc89"
    }
  ]
}

      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }

          "name",
          "id"

    "extractedFields"

/content/usercontent/extractedfield/{extractedFieldId} delete

delete

Remove extracted field from "My Content"

delete /content/usercontent/extractedfield/{extractedFieldId}

Remove extracted field from "My Content"

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • extractedFieldId: required (string)

    The extracted field ID. The list of available extracted field IDs can be retrieved using Get user extracted fields

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean - default: false)

    Force delete the field and ignore its dependencies

HTTP status code 200

Item successfully deleted

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: text/plain

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 404

Not found.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Not Found

HTTP status code 409

The field has dependencies

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

The field has dependencies. Use query parameter(?force=true) to force delete

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/sharedcontent post get

post

Import to "Shared Content". Importing only dashboards, bookmarked queries, and extracted fields.

get

Export all shared content as a content pack

post /content/sharedcontent

Import to "Shared Content". Importing only dashboards, bookmarked queries, and extracted fields.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "author": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "url": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "info": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "instructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "upgradeInstructions": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "icon": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "displayName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "preContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "postContext": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "regexValue": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "internalName": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "constraints": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "queries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "options": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "alerts": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "alertType": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "chartQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "messageQuery": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "hitCount": {
            "searchInterval": "integer"
          },
          "hitOperator": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "searchPeriod": {
            "type": "integer"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "dashboardSections": {
      "type": "array",
      "maxItems": 1,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "header": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "views": {
            "type": "array",
            "items": {
              "name": {
                "type": "string"
              },
              "constraints": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "internalName": {
                    "type": "string"
                  },
                  "operator": {
                    "type": "string"
                  }
                }
              },
              "rows": {
                "type": "array",
                "items": {
                  "widgets": {
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "name": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "info": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartOptions": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "widgetType": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "chartQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      },
                      "messageQuery": {
                        "type": "string"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "agentClasses": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "info": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "agentConfig": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "aliasFields": {
      "type": "array"
    },
    "aliasRules": {
      "type": "array"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name",
    "namespace",
    "contentVersion"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example",
  "icon": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 200

Get imported contect pack

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

Only users with Edit Shared or higher permissions can import content pack to "Shared Content".

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Forbidden

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

get /content/sharedcontent

Export all shared content as a content pack

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • namespace: required (string)

    Namespace is a unique identifier required for creating a content pack based on the shared content, e.g. com.company.product

HTTP status code 200

Content pack containing all shared content.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "namespace": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "contentPackId": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "framework": {
      "type": "string"

    "version": {

  "name": "VMware - Test",
  "namespace": "com.vmware.test",
  "contentPackId": "com.vmware.test",
  "framework": "#9c4",
  "version": "2.4",
  "extractedFields": [
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_device_id",
      "preContext": "",
      "postContext": "",
      "regexValue": "((naa|eui|sym|sns|t10)\\.[0-9a-z]+|mpx\\.vmhba[0-9]+:C[0-9]+:T[0-9]+:L[0-9]+)",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "Example",
      "info": "Example"
    },
    {
      "displayName": "vmw_esxi_scsi_sense_data",
      "preContext": "(Possible|Valid) sense data: ",
      "postContext": "\\.",
      "regexValue": ".*?",
      "internalName": "Example",
      "constraints": "{\"filters\":[{\"internalName\":\"appname\",\"hidden\":false}]}",
      "info": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "queries": [
    {
      "name": "Example",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "options": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "alerts": [
    {
      "name": "Storage: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)",
      "info": "Example",
      "alertType": "RATE_BASED_WITH_GROUPS",
      "chartQuery": "{}",
      "messageQuery": "{}",
      "hitCount": 1,
      "hitOperator": "GREATER_THAN",
      "searchPeriod": 300000,
      "searchInterval": 60000
    }
  ],
  "dashboardSections": [
    {
      "views": [
        {
          "name": "General - Overview",
          "constraints": [
            {
              "internalName": "__li_source_path",
              "operator": "CONTAINS"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "hostname",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            },
            {
              "internalName": "vsphere",
              "operator": "EQUAL"
            }
          ],
          "rows": [
            {
              "widgets": [
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"legend\":true,\"trendline\":false}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                },
                {
                  "name": "All vSphere events by hostname",
                  "info": "Example",
                  "chartType": "Example",
                  "chartOptions": "{\"logaxis\":false,\"pielabelstyle\":\"legend\",\"piestyle\":\"normal\"}",
                  "widgetType": "chart",
                  "chartQuery": "{}",
                  "messageQuery": "{}"
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "header": ""
    }
  ],
  "agentClasses": [
    {
      "name": "vSphere 5.x - vCenter (Linux) SSO",
      "info": "<span>Meant for standalone Linux-based SSO systems.</span><br>",
      "agentConfig": "Example"
    }
  ],
  "aliasFields": [],
  "aliasRules": [],
  "author": "VMware, Inc.",
  "url": "https://www.vmware.com/products/vsphere",
  "contentVersion": "4.3",
  "info": "Example",
  "instructions": "Example",
  "upgradeInstructions": "Example"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/content/sharedcontent/dashboard

Shared dashboards group URL

/content/sharedcontent/dashboard/list get

get

Returns the list of all dashboards meta information from "Shared Content", e.g. name, ID

get /content/sharedcontent/dashboard/list

Returns the list of all dashboards meta information from "Shared Content", e.g. name, ID

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

List of all dashboard names and IDs

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "dashboards": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "id"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "dashboards"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "dashboards":[
    {
      "name":"example1",
      "id":"1"
    },
    {
      "name":"example2",
      "id":"2"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Type: text/plain

Example:

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Remove dashboard from "Shared Content"

delete /content/sharedcontent/dashboard/{dashboardId}

Remove dashboard from "Shared Content"

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • dashboardId: required (string)

    The dashboard ID. The list of available dashboard IDs can be retrieved using Get shared dashboards

HTTP status code 200

List of all bookmarked query names and IDs

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "bookmarkedQueries": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "id"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "bookmarkedQueries"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "bookmarkedQueries":[
    {
      "name":"example1",
      "id":"b64075a2-ae27-4606-9d7f-fb7eae0b4147"
    },
    {
      "name":"example2",
      "id":"191ddaa3-4d47-4bb8-8205-6c8ea286fc89"
    }
  ]
}

Type: application/json

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "extractedFields": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "name": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "id": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "name",
          "id"
        ]
      }
    }
  },

    "extractedFields"
  ]

      "name":"example1",

  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • extractedFieldId: required (string)

    The extracted field ID. The list of available extracted field IDs can be retrieved using Get shared extracted fields

Query Parameters

  • force: (boolean - default: false)

    Force delete the field and ignore its dependencies

/datasets

A collection of data sets. Data Sets are used to provide users with access to specific content. They are comprised of a set of filters that can then be associated with a Role.

/datasets get post

get

Gets a list of all data sets.

post

Creates a new data set.

get /datasets

Gets a list of all data sets.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

  • includeDisplayMeta: (boolean - default: false)

  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema"
}

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/datasets/{dataSetId} get post patch delete

Represents a single data set.

get

Retrieves the settings of a data set.

post

Updates the settings of a data set.

patch

Updates the settings of a data set.

delete

Deletes a data set.

get /datasets/{dataSetId}

Retrieves the settings of a data set.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • dataSetId: required (string)

    TODO: add a description

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

Query Parameters

  • includeDisplayMeta: (boolean - default: false)

    TODO: add a description

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}
