    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/licenses

Represents the license state, including a list of licenses. The existing licenses can be enumerated, or a new license can be added to the current list.

/licenses get post

get

Retrieve the license state, including a list of licenses.

post

Add a new license to the collection. A UUID will be generated to represent the license, and can be used for deletion. The license summary cannot be set, and is derived from the license key. In addition, a single license key cannot be updated in-place. Instead, the old license keys should be deleted after the new license is added.

get /licenses

Retrieve the license state, including a list of licenses.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the License information

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "licensekey": {
      "name": "licence_key",
      "id": "#licensekey",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "status": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "error": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "configuration": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "expiration": {
          "type": "number"
        },
        "licenseKey": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "infinite": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "count": {
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "typeEnum": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    "licensekeys": {
      "name": "license_keys",
      "id": "#licensekeys",
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": true,
      "patternProperties": {
        "^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/licensekey"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "id": "#existinglicenses",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "licenseState": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "ACTIVE",
        "LIMITED",
        "EXPIRED",
        "UNINITIALIZED",
        "ERROR",
        "DELETED"
      ]
    },
    "maxOsis": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "maxCpus": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "hasCpu": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "hasOsi": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "hasTap": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "licenses": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/licensekeys"
        }
      ]
    },
    "standardLicenseCapabilities": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string",
        "enum": [
          "FORWARDING",
          "RBAC",
          "UPGRADE",
          "CUSTOM_SSL",
          "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
          "CONTENT_PACK",
          "VSPHERE_FULL_SUPPORT",
          "CLUSTER",
          "IMPORT_CONTENT_PACKS",
          "QUERY",
          "ARCHIVE",
          "THIRD_PARTY_CONTENT_PACKS"
        ]
      }
    },
    "limitedLicenseCapabilities": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string",
        "enum": [
          "QUERY",
          "RBAC",
          "UPGRADE",
          "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
          "CONTENT_PACK"
        ]
      }
    },
    "uninitializedLicenseCapabilities": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string",
        "enum": [
          "RBAC",
          "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
          "CONTENT_PACK"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "licenseState",
    "maxOsis",
    "maxCpus",
    "hasCpu",
    "hasOsi",
    "hasTap",
    "licenses",
    "standardLicenseCapabilities",
    "limitedLicenseCapabilities",
    "uninitializedLicenseCapabilities"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

Example:

{
  "licenseState": "ACTIVE",
  "maxOsis": 0,
  "maxCpus": 0,
  "hasCpu": false,
  "hasOsi": true,
  "hasTap": false,
  "licenses": {
    "95bfa29a-e60d-49e7-b00e-8c40d83f2036": {
      "id": "95bfa29a-e60d-49e7-b00e-8c40d83f2036",
      "status": "Active",
      "error": "",
      "configuration": "1 Operating System Instance (OSI)",
      "licenseKey": "4J2TK-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX",
      "infinite": true,
      "count": 0,
      "typeEnum": "OSI",
      "expiration": -14400000,
      "createdDate": 1498731608705,
      "expirationString": "",
      "createdDateString": "2017-06-29 14:20:08.705 GMT+04:00"
    }
  },
  "standardLicenseCapabilities": [
    "FORWARDING",
    "RBAC",
    "UPGRADE",
    "CUSTOM_SSL",
    "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
    "CONTENT_PACK",
    "VSPHERE_FULL_SUPPORT",
    "CLUSTER",
    "IMPORT_CONTENT_PACKS",
    "QUERY",
    "ARCHIVE",
    "THIRD_PARTY_CONTENT_PACKS"
  ],
  "limitedLicenseCapabilities": [
    "QUERY",
    "RBAC",
    "UPGRADE",
    "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
    "CONTENT_PACK"
  ],
  "uninitializedLicenseCapabilities": [
    "RBAC",
    "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
    "CONTENT_PACK"
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /licenses

Add a new license to the collection. A UUID will be generated to represent the license, and can be used for deletion. The license summary cannot be set, and is derived from the license key. In addition, a single license key cannot be updated in-place. Instead, the old license keys should be deleted after the new license is added.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "title": "License Key Added",
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "key": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}$"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "key"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "key":"M502V-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX"
}

HTTP status code 201

Created a new license with the provided license key.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "title": "License Key Added",
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "id": {
      "title": "UUID",
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$"
    },
    "status": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "error": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "configuration": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "licenseKey": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}-[0-9A-Z]{5}$"
    },
    "infinite": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "count": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "typeEnum": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "expiration": {
      "type": "number"
    },
    "createdDate": {
      "type": "number"
    },
    "expirationString": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "createdDateString": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "id",
    "status",
    "count",
    "licenseKey"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "id": "abcdef12-3456-7890-ba36-123456789012",
  "status":"Active",
  "error":"",
  "configuration":"1 Operating System Instance (OSI)",
  "licenseKey":"M502V-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX",
  "infinite":true,
  "count":0,
  "typeEnum":"OSI",
  "expiration": -14400000,
  "createdDate": 1498731659310,
  "expirationString": "",
  "createdDateString": "2017-06-29 14:20:59.310 GMT+04:00"
}

HTTP status code 400

Error when trying to upload an invalid license key

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Invalid serial number"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 409

Error when trying to upload the license key which already exists

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "License already exists."
}

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/licenses/{licenseId} delete

Remove a single license key, specified by its UUID.

delete

Remove a single license key, specified by its UUID.

delete /licenses/{licenseId}

Remove a single license key, specified by its UUID.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • licenseId: required (string)

    License ID of the license to delete.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

HTTP status code 200

Successfully deleted a license.

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

Example:

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

/notification

/notification/channels get put

get

Gets a list of all the notification channels that are used for alerting. At this time, the list includes SMTP server configuration used for sending alert emails.

put

Updates the configurations for the notification channels that are used for alerting. At this time, the list includes SMTP server configuration used for sending alert emails.

get /notification/channels

Gets a list of all the notification channels that are used for alerting. At this time, the list includes SMTP server configuration used for sending alert emails.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the SMTP server configuration used for sending email alerts.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "smtpserverconfig": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "server",
        "port",
        "sslAuth",
        "tls",
        "defaultSender",
        "login",
        "password"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "server": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "port": {
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "sslAuth": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "tls": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "defaultSender": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "login": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "password": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    "notificationserverconfig": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "type",
        "config"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "type": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": [
            "email"
          ]
        },
        "config": {
          "oneOf": [
            {
              "$ref": "#/definitions/smtpserverconfig"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "id": "NotificationChannels",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "channels": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "oneOf": [
          {
            "$ref": "#/definitions/notificationserverconfig"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "channels": [
    {
      "type": "email",
      "config": {
        "server": "smtp.example.com",
        "port": 25,
        "sslAuth": false,
        "tls": false,
        "defaultSender": "email@example.com",
        "login": "user@example.com",
        "password": ""
      }
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

Example:

  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

put /notification/channels

Updates the configurations for the notification channels that are used for alerting. At this time, the list includes SMTP server configuration used for sending alert emails.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "smtpserverconfig": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "server",
        "port",
        "sslAuth",
        "tls",
        "defaultSender",
        "login",
        "password"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "server": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "port": {
          "type": "integer"
        },
        "sslAuth": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "tls": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "defaultSender": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "login": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "password": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    },
    "notificationserverconfig": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "type",
        "config"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "type": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": [
            "email"
          ]
        },
        "config": {
          "oneOf": [
            {
              "$ref": "#/definitions/smtpserverconfig"
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "id": "NotificationChannels",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "channels": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "oneOf": [
          {
            "$ref": "#/definitions/notificationserverconfig"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "channels": [
    {
      "type": "email",
      "config": {
        "server": "smtp.example.com",
        "port": 25,
        "sslAuth": false,
        "tls": false,
        "defaultSender": "email@example.com",
        "login": "user@example.com",
        "password": ""
      }
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully updated the SMTP configurations used for sending alert emails.

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "emails": {
    "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      }
     }
  },
  "required": [
    "emails"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "emails": ["email1@address.com", "email2@address.com"]
}

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "URLs": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "URLs"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "URLs": ["http://example.com/webhook1", "http://example.com/webhook2"]
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully updated the list of webhook URLs configured for receiving system notifications.

HTTP status code 400

Failed to apply configuration changes, either because of a parse error or invalid configuration options.

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/notification/config/retention-threshold get put

get

Retrieve current retention notification threshold configuration. If the amount of data the system can hold at the current ingestion rate is less than the given amount, send a system notification. E.g., if you are receiving 10 GB/day of data and you have 200 GB of space, then you have 20 days of capacity. If you set your threshold to 1 month, you will receive a notification that you are below this capacity.

put

Update retention notification threshold configuration.

get /notification/config/retention-threshold

Retrieve current retention notification threshold configuration. If the amount of data the system can hold at the current ingestion rate is less than the given amount, send a system notification. E.g., if you are receiving 10 GB/day of data and you have 200 GB of space, then you have 20 days of capacity. If you set your threshold to 1 month, you will receive a notification that you are below this capacity.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved retention notification threshold configuration.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "sendNotification": {
      "type" : "boolean"
    },
    "dataInterval": {
      "type" : "integer"
    },
    "intervalUnit": {
      "enum": [
        "MINUTES",
        "HOURS",
        "DAYS",
        "WEEKS",
        "MONTHS"
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "sendNotification" : true,
  "dataInterval" : 2,
  "intervalUnit" : "MONTHS"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

      "type": "string"

  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]

  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."

Secured by Bearer

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/sessions

How to authenticate to Log Insight

Use the POST /api/v1/sessions API to sign into Log Insight. For example:

POST /api/v1/sessions HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json
User-Agent: YourAppName/1.0

{
    "username": "username",
    "password": "password",
    "provider": "Local"
}

The API response contains a session ID that you can use with subsequent API requests:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "userId": "cc251b9f-b4d0-437d-86de-8ac560d45e55",
  "sessionId": "80Lmue52xwIgDiQMu7as9jLdLFFs+Hn3HI2WP0fx6kH0ApL",
  "ttl": 1800
}

How to send authorized requests

To send an authorized API request, add the Authorization header to the request. Set the value of the header to the word Bearer, followed by a single space character, and then followed by the session ID returned from the POST /api/v1/sessions request.

GET /api/v1/time
User-Agent: YourAppName/1.0
Authorization: Bearer 80Lmue52xwIgDiQMu7as9jLdLFFs+Hn3HI2WP0fx6kH0ApL

/sessions post

post

Signs into Log Insight with the given credentials, creates and returns a new session.

post /sessions

Signs into Log Insight with the given credentials, creates and returns a new session.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "title": "Login",
  "properties": {
    "username": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "password": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "provider": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^(Local|ActiveDirectory)$"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "username",
    "password",
    "provider"
  ],
  "type": "object"
}

Example:

{
  "username": "johndoe",
  "password": "password",
  "provider": "Local"
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully signed into Log Insight.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "userId": {
      "description": "UUID",
      "type": "string",
      "id": "#userId",
      "pattern": "^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$"
    },
    "sessionId": {
      "description": "An opaque session ID for use in the Authorization header.",
      "type": "string",
      "minLength": 1,
      "id": "#sessionId"
    },
    "ttl": {
      "description": "Time to live: Number of seconds this session is valid for.",
      "type": "integer",
      "minimum": 0,
      "id": "#ttl"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "userId",
    "sessionId",
    "ttl"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "userId": "cc251b9f-b4d0-437d-86de-8ac560d45e55",
  "sessionId": "80Lmue52xwIgDiQMu7as9jLdLFFs+Hn3HI2WP0fx6kH0ApL",
  "ttl": 1800
}

HTTP status code 401

Could not sign in with the given credentials.

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Invalid username or password.",
  "errorCode": "FIELD_ERROR"
}

HTTP status code 503

Log Insight did not have its initial configuration set up yet. See /deployment/new.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "LI server should be bootstrapped to process this API call"
}

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

/time

Time is critical to the core functionality of VMware vRealize Log Insight. You must synchronize the time on the Log Insight virtual appliance with an NTP server or with the ESX/ESXi host on which you deployed the virtual appliance.

/time get

get

Retrieve the current time from the server's perspective, expressed as milliseconds-since-epoch UTC.

Constraints used for an events query include operators. The time range for the LAST operator is relative to the current time. See the constraints reference section of /events for details.

get /time

Retrieve the current time from the server's perspective, expressed as milliseconds-since-epoch UTC.

Constraints used for an events query include operators. The time range for the LAST operator is relative to the current time. See the constraints reference section of /events for details.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the server's current time.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "currentTime": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "currentTimeString": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "currentTime": 1496995473577,
  "currentTimeString": "2017-06-09 12:04:33.577 GMT+04:00"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

/time/config get put

Time source synchronization settings.

Time is critical to the core functionality of VMware vRealize Log Insight. You must synchronize the time on the Log Insight virtual appliance with an NTP server or with the ESX/ESXi host on which you deployed the virtual appliance.

By default, vRealize Log Insight synchronizes time with a pre-defined list of public NTP servers. If public NTP servers are not accessible due to a firewall, you can use the internal NTP server of your company. If no NTP servers are available, you can sync time with the ESX/ESXi host where you have deployed the vRealize Log Insight virtual appliance.

get

Retrieve the current list of time sources for this cluster.

put

Set new time sources for this cluster.

get /time/config

Retrieve the current list of time sources for this cluster.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the current time source.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "timesource": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": [
        "timeReference"
      ],
      "properties": {
        "timeReference": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": [
            "NTP_SERVER",
            "ESX_HOST"
          ]
        },
        "ntpServers": {
          "id": "#ntpServers",
          "description": "List of remote NTP server FQDN/IPs",
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "id": "TimeSyncronization",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "ntpConfig": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/timesource"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "ntpConfig": {
    "timeReference": "NTP_SERVER",
    "ntpServers": [
      "0.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
      "1.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
      "2.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
      "3.vmware.pool.ntp.org"
    ]
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

put /time/config

Set new time sources for this cluster.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "timeReference": {
      "enum": [
        "NTP_SERVER",
        "ESX_HOST"
      ]
    },
    "ntpServers": {
      "type": "array",
        "servernames": {
           "type": "string"
        }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "timeReference": "NTP_SERVER",
  "ntpServers": [
    "0.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "1.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "2.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "3.vmware.pool.ntp.org"
  ]
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully applied new time source settings.

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

/time/test post

post

Test connectivity to new NTP servers. May take up to 20 seconds per server listed.

post /time/test

Test connectivity to new NTP servers. May take up to 20 seconds per server listed.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "description": "Test NTP servers",
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "ntpServers": {
      "description": "List of remote NTP server FQDN/IPs",
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "ntpServers": [
    "0.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "1.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "2.vmware.pool.ntp.org",
    "3.vmware.pool.ntp.org"
  ]
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully tested connectivity to NTP servers.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "testedNTPServers": {
      "description": "List of remote NTP server FQDN/IPs",
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "server": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "state": {
            "type": "string",
            "enum": [
              "fail",
              "pass"
            ]
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "testedNTPServers": [
    { "server": "0.vmware.pool.ntp.org", "state": "pass" },
    { "server": "1.vmware.pool.ntp.org", "state": "pass" },
    { "server": "2.vmware.pool.ntp.org", "state": "pass" },
    { "server": "3.vmware.pool.ntp.org", "state": "fail" }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/ui

Represents the list of configurations for UI.

/ui/browser-session get put

By default, vRealize Log Insight Web sessions expire in 30 minutes. You can increase or decrease the timeout duration, or disable it entirely.

get

Retrieve current browser session timeout, expressed in minutes.

put

Set a new browser session timeout, expressed in minutes. Specify -1 for no timeout.

get /ui/browser-session

Retrieve current browser session timeout, expressed in minutes.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Browser session timeout configuration was retrieved successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "timeout": {
      "type" : "integer",
      "minimum": -1
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "timeout" : 20
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

put /ui/browser-session

Set a new browser session timeout, expressed in minutes. Specify -1 for no timeout.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "timeout": {
      "type" : "integer",
      "minimum": -1
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "timeout" : 20
}

HTTP status code 200

Browser session timeout was saved successfully.

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Example:

      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/ui/language get put

The VMware vRealize Log Insight user interface is localized to several languages. However, you can administratively force use of the English (EN_US) translation for all users.

get

Retrieve current language configuration.

put

Set a new language configuration.

get /ui/language

Retrieve current language configuration.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Language configuration was retrieved successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "alwaysUseEnglish": {
      "type" : "boolean"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "alwaysUseEnglish" : true
}

/upgrades

Represents the list of active upgrade operations.

/upgrades post get

post

Starts the process of upgrading Log Insight to a new version. This request uploads a PAK file containing the new version, and sets the upgrade status to "Pending". PAK file URL should be provided in JSON body. It's also possible to upload PAK file directly as a binary data by setting 'Content-Type' header to 'application/octet-stream' and sending PAK file as a body. It returns the new End User License Agreement (EULA) and upgrade version. To continue with the upgrade, send a PUT /upgrades/{version}/eula with eulaAccepted set to true.

get

Gets the upgraded version of the Log Insight cluster.

post /upgrades

Starts the process of upgrading Log Insight to a new version. This request uploads a PAK file containing the new version, and sets the upgrade status to "Pending". PAK file URL should be provided in JSON body. It's also possible to upload PAK file directly as a binary data by setting 'Content-Type' header to 'application/octet-stream' and sending PAK file as a body. It returns the new End User License Agreement (EULA) and upgrade version. To continue with the upgrade, send a PUT /upgrades/{version}/eula with eulaAccepted set to true.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "pakUrl": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [ "pakUrl" ]
}

Example:

{
  "pakUrl": "http://vmware.com/downloads/VMware-vRealize-Log-Insight-4.0.0.pak"
}

Type: application/octet-stream

Example:

PAK file containing new version of the Log Insight

HTTP status code 200

The upgrade was started successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "eula": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "eula": "VMware Agreement text",
  "version": "4.0.0-1234567"
}

HTTP status code 400

The request failed because the request body either did not contain valid JSON, or did not match the required JSON format.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Invalid request body.",
  "errorCode": "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "reason": "..."
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

get /upgrades

Gets the upgraded version of the Log Insight cluster.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

The upgraded version was retrieved successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UpgradeNodeList": {
      "type": "object",
      "name": "UpgradeNodeList",
      "id": "#UpgradeNodeList",
      "patternProperties": {
        "^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/NodeUpgradeStatus"
        }
      }
    },
    "NodeUpgradeStatus": {
      "type": "object",
      "name": "NodeUpgradeStatus",
      "id": "#NodeUpgradeStatus",
      "properties": {
        "version": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "fullVersion": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "fullVersion": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "stable": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "nodes": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/UpgradeNodeList"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
  "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567",
  "stable": true,
  "nodes": {
    "5817df88-7383-43cb-bf2b-aa87de412213": {
      "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
      "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567"
    },
    "74108d1e-7ec2-4524-b5ca-864957654d2e": {
      "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
      "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567"
    },
    "61f3dfb1-dcf2-4e6d-9335-6271716d8055": {
      "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
      "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567"
    },
    "c73f9683-0319-4fee-a3a8-a841c62e6b61": {
      "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
      "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Type: text/plain

Example:

    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

     "version": {
       "type": "string"
     },
     "fullVersion": {
       "type": "string"
     }
  }
}

  "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
  "fullVersion": "4.0.0-1234567"
}

/upgrades/{version} get

get

Gets the cluster-wide status of the upgrade.

get /upgrades/{version}

Gets the cluster-wide status of the upgrade.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • version: required (string)

    The Log Insight version of the upgrade

    Example:

    4.0.0-1234567

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the upgrade status of the cluster.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UpgradeStatusSingleNode":{
        "id": "UpgradeStatusSingleNode",
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "status": {
            "type": "string",
            "enum": [
              "Started",
              "PendingSnapshot",
              "CreatingSnapshot",
              "Pending",
              "TransferringPak",
              "Upgrading",
              "Restarting",
              "Verifying",
              "Complete",
              "Cancelled",
              "Failed",
              "NewDeployment"
            ]
          },
          "timestamp": {
            "type": "number",
            "id": "#timestamp"
          },
          "timestampString": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "token": {
            "type": "string",
            "id": "#token"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "status",
          "timestamp",
          "timestampString",
          "token"
        ]
      },
    "upgradestatus": {
      "id": "#upgradestatus",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "version": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "pakFileName": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "nodeStatuses": {
          "type": "array",
          "uniqueItems": true,
          "items": { "oneOf": [
            {"$ref":"#/definitions/UpgradeStatusSingleNode"}
          ]}
        },
        "pakFileUrl": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "eulaAccepted": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "masterToken": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "clusterStatus": {
          "enum": [
            "Started",
            "PendingSnapshot",
            "CreatingSnapshot",
            "Pending",
            "TransferringPak",
            "Upgrading",
            "Restarting",
            "Verifying",
            "Complete",
            "Cancelled",
            "Failed",
            "NewDeployment"
          ]
        },
        "started": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "finished": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "startedString": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "finishedString": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "title": "Upgrade to Version Status",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "status": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/upgradestatus"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "status": {
    "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
    "pakFileName": "VMware-vRealize-Log-Insight-4.0.0-1234567.pak",
    "nodeStatuses": [{
      "status": "Upgrading",
      "timestamp": 1496145083890,
      "timestampString": "2017-05-30 15:51:23.890 GMT+04:00",
      "token": "27bcbafc-b99d-4609-9fab-4f3ad937fe5e"
      }],
    "pakFileUrl": "http://vmware.com/downloads/VMware-vRealize-Log-Insight-4.0.0.pak",
    "eulaAccepted": false,
    "masterToken": "27bcbafc-b99d-4609-9fab-4f3ad937fe5e",
    "clusterStatus": "Upgrading",
    "started": "1496145083067",
    "finished": "0",
    "startedString": "2017-05-30 15:51:23.067 GMT+04:00",
    "finishedString": ""
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/upgrades/{version}/eula put

put

Accepts or declines the End User License Agreement (EULA) of a product upgrade. Continues the upgrade process if accepted is true, or cancels it otherwise. This request is expected when the upgrade status is "Pending".

put /upgrades/{version}/eula

Accepts or declines the End User License Agreement (EULA) of a product upgrade. Continues the upgrade process if accepted is true, or cancels it otherwise. This request is expected when the upgrade status is "Pending".

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • version: required (string)

    The Log Insight version of the upgrade

    Example:

    4.0.0-1234567

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "accepted": {
      "type": "boolean",
      "default": false
    }
  },
  "required": [ "accepted" ]
}

Example:

{
  "accepted": true
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfully accepted or declined the EULA. Returns the upgrade status of the cluster.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UpgradeStatusSingleNode":{
        "id": "UpgradeStatusSingleNode",
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "status": {
            "type": "string",
            "enum": [
              "Started",
              "PendingSnapshot",
              "CreatingSnapshot",
              "Pending",
              "TransferringPak",
              "Upgrading",
              "Restarting",
              "Verifying",
              "Complete",
              "Cancelled",
              "Failed",
              "NewDeployment"
            ]
          },
          "timestamp": {
            "type": "number",
            "id": "#timestamp"
          },
          "timestampString": {
            "type": "string"
          },
          "token": {
            "type": "string",
            "id": "#token"
          }
        },
        "required": [
          "status",
          "timestamp",
          "timestampString",
          "token"
        ]
      },
    "upgradestatus": {
      "id": "#upgradestatus",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "version": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "pakFileName": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "nodeStatuses": {
          "type": "array",
          "uniqueItems": true,
          "items": { "oneOf": [
            {"$ref":"#/definitions/UpgradeStatusSingleNode"}
          ]}
        },
        "pakFileUrl": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "eulaAccepted": {
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "masterToken": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "clusterStatus": {
          "enum": [
            "Started",
            "PendingSnapshot",
            "CreatingSnapshot",
            "Pending",
            "TransferringPak",
            "Upgrading",
            "Restarting",
            "Verifying",
            "Complete",
            "Cancelled",
            "Failed",
            "NewDeployment"
          ]
        },
        "started": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "finished": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "startedString": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "finishedString": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "title": "Upgrade to Version Status",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "status": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/upgradestatus"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "status": {
    "started": "1471285414207",
    "finished": "0",
    "version": "4.0.0-1234567",
    "pakFileName": "VMware-vRealize-Log-Insight-4.0.0-1234567.pak",
    "nodeStatuses": [{
      "status": "Upgrading",
      "token": "27bcbafc-b99d-4609-9fab-4f3ad937fe5e",
      "timestamp": 1498657510765,
      "timestampString": "2017-06-28 17:45:10.765 GMT+04:00"
      }],
    "pakFileUrl": "http://vmware.com/downloads/VMware-vRealize-Log-Insight-4.0.0.pak",
    "eulaAccepted": true,
    "masterToken": "27bcbafc-b99d-4609-9fab-4f3ad937fe5e",
    "clusterStatus": "Upgrading"
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/users

A collection of users that have rights to access Log Insight.

/users get post

get

Gets a list of users.

post

Creates a new user.

get /users

Gets a list of users.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • includeExtendedData: (boolean - default: false)

    Indicates whether to include extended information in the results, such as the capabilities of the user and the groups they are a member of.

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the list of users.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UserAccount": {
      "description": "User account",
      "name": "useraccount",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "username": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "apiId": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "email": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "type": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "id",
        "username",
        "apiId",
        "email",
        "type"
      ]
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "users": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "oneOf": [
          {
            "$ref": "#/definitions/UserAccount"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "users"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": "de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014",
      "username": "johndoe",
      "apiId": "8d03c137-74e4-4a99-921d-4e2867de4fa7",
      "email": "",
      "type": "DEFAULT"
    },
    {
      "id": "3794f9d6-2e93-4d0f-9850-d0cf9172b3a3",
      "username": "admin",
      "apiId": "46fc4cf5-c633-4352-9b69-bd8cf553981f",
      "email": "",
      "type": "DEFAULT"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /users

Creates a new user.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "username": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "password": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "email": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "groupIds": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    },
    "generateApiKey": {
      "type": "boolean"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "username",
    "password",
    "email",
    "groupIds",
    "generateApiKey"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "username": "johndoe",
  "password": "Password123!",
  "email": "johndoe@example.com",
  "groupIds": [ "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002" ],
  "generateApiKey": false
}

HTTP status code 200

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

HTTP status code 201

Successfully added a user.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UserAccount": {
      "description": "User account",
      "name": "useraccount",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "username": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "apiId": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "groupIds": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "capabilities": {
          "id": "#capabilities",
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "id": {
                "enum": [
                  "ANALYTICS",
                  "VIEW_ADMIN",
                  "INTERNAL",
                  "EDIT_SHARED",
                  "EDIT_ADMIN",
                  "STATISTICS",
                  "INVENTORY",
                  "DASHBOARD"
                ]
              }
            },
            "required": [
              "id"
            ]
          }
        },
        "userCapabilities": {
          "id": "#userCapabilities",
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "id": {
                "enum": [
                  "ANALYTICS",
                  "VIEW_ADMIN",
                  "INTERNAL",
                  "EDIT_SHARED",
                  "EDIT_ADMIN",
                  "STATISTICS",
                  "INVENTORY",
                  "DASHBOARD"
                ]
              }
            },
            "required": [
              "id"
            ]
          }
        },
        "userDataSets": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "email": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "type": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "id",
        "username",
        "apiId",
        "groupIds",
        "capabilities",
        "userCapabilities",
        "email",
        "type"
      ]
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "user": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/UserAccount"
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "user"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "user": {
    "id": "de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014",
    "username": "johndoe",
    "apiId": "8d03c137-74e4-4a99-921d-4e2867de4fa7",
    "groupIds": [
      "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"
    ],
    "capabilities": [
      { "id": "ANALYTICS" },
      { "id": "DASHBOARD" }
    ],
    "userCapabilities": [
      { "id": "ANALYTICS" },
      { "id": "DASHBOARD" }
    ],
    "email": "johndoe@example.com",
    "type": "DEFAULT"
  }
}

Represents the user logged-in to the API.

post

delete

Deletes all snapshots of the logger-in user.

/users/{userId} get delete post patch

Represents a single user.

get

Retrieves the settings of a user.

delete

Deletes a user.

post

Modifies the settings of a user.

patch

Modifies the settings of a user.

get /users/{userId}

Retrieves the settings of a user.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The unique identifier of the user.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

Query Parameters

  • includeExtendedData: (boolean - default: false)

    Indicates whether to include extended information in the results, such as the capabilities of the user and the groups they are a member of.

HTTP status code 200

Successfully retrieved the users settings.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "definitions": {
    "UserAccount": {
      "description": "User account",
      "name": "useraccount",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "username": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "apiId": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "groupIds": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "capabilities": {
          "id": "#capabilities",
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "id": {
                "enum": [
                  "ANALYTICS",
                  "VIEW_ADMIN",
                  "INTERNAL",
                  "EDIT_SHARED",
                  "EDIT_ADMIN",
                  "STATISTICS",
                  "INVENTORY",
                  "DASHBOARD"
                ]
              }
            },
            "required": [
              "id"
            ]
          }
        },
        "userCapabilities": {
          "id": "#userCapabilities",
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "id": {
                "enum": [
                  "ANALYTICS",
                  "VIEW_ADMIN",
                  "INTERNAL",
                  "EDIT_SHARED",
                  "EDIT_ADMIN",
                  "STATISTICS",
                  "INVENTORY",
                  "DASHBOARD"
                ]
              }
            },
            "required": [
              "id"
            ]
          }
        },
        "userDataSets": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "email": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "type": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "id",
        "username",
        "apiId",
        "groupIds",
        "capabilities",
        "userCapabilities",
        "email",
        "type"
      ]
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "user": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/UserAccount"
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "user"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "user": {
    "id": "de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014",
    "username": "johndoe",
    "apiId": "8d03c137-74e4-4a99-921d-4e2867de4fa7",
    "groupIds": [
      "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002"
    ],
    "capabilities": [
      { "id": "ANALYTICS" },
      { "id": "DASHBOARD" }
    ],
    "userCapabilities": [
      { "id": "ANALYTICS" },
      { "id": "DASHBOARD" }
    ],
    "userDataSets": [],
    "email": "johndoe@example.com",
    "apiKey": "am9obmRvZWpvaG5kb2Vqb2huZG9lam9obmRvZWpvaG5kb2Vqb2huZG9l",
    "type": "DEFAULT"
  }
}

HTTP status code 400

The parameters could not be understood.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Bad request received (Cannot parse parameter userId as UUID: Invalid UUID string: johndoe): GET /api/v1/users/johndoe"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 404

A user with the given identifier was not found.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Specified user does not exist.",
  "errorCode": "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "errorCode": "com.vmware.loginsight.api.errors.rbac.user_does_not_exist"
  }
}

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

delete /users/{userId}

Deletes a user.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The unique identifier of the user.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

/users/{userId}/capabilities get post patch put

A collection of capabilities of a user. Capabilibities determine what a user is allowed to do with Log Insight.

get

Gets a list of capabilities of the user.

post

Adds and removes capabilities to a user.

patch

Adds and removes capabilities to a user.

put

Sets the capabilities of a user.

get /users/{userId}/capabilities

Gets a list of capabilities of the user.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The unique identifier of the user.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

/users/{userId}/capabilities/{capability} get

Represents a single capability. Capabilibities determine what a user is allowed to do with Log Insight.

get

Checks if the user has the capability.

Checks if the user has the capability.

/users/{userId}/datasets get post patch put

A collection of data sets a user can access.

get

Gets the collection of data sets the user can access.

post

Adds and removes data sets the user can access.

patch

Adds and removes data sets the user can access.

put

Sets the data sets the user can access.

get /users/{userId}/datasets

Gets the collection of data sets the user can access.

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

put /users/{userId}/datasets

Sets the data sets the user can access.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The unique identifier of the user.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema"
}

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 200

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/users/{userId}/groups get post patch put

A collection of groups the user is a member of. The user can access all the resources that the group can.

get

Gets a list of groups the user is a member of.

post

Adds and removes the user as a member of groups.

patch

Adds and removes the user as a member of groups.

put

Sets the group membership of the user.

get /users/{userId}/groups

Gets a list of groups the user is a member of.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • userId: required (string)

    The unique identifier of the user.

    Example:

    de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014

HTTP status code 200
