/users/{userId}/snapshots get post delete

A collection of snapshots owned by the user.

get

Gets the snapshots owned by a user.

post

Creates a snapshot.

delete

Deletes all snapshots owned by a user.

get /users/{userId}/snapshots

Gets the snapshots owned by a user.

Secured by Bearer

/version

/version get

get

Retrieve Log Insight version information, in the form Major.Minor.Patch-Build.

get /version

Retrieve Log Insight version information, in the form Major.Minor.Patch-Build.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "releaseName": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "version": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "releaseName",
    "version"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "releaseName": "GA",
  "version": "1.2.3-4567890"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "The operation failed due to an internal error."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/vidm

/vidm get post

get

Gets the current vIDM configuration.

post

Configures vIDM integration.

get /vidm

Gets the current vIDM configuration.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Gets the current vIDM configuration.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "enabled": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "hostname": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "port": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "tenant": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "redirectURL": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required" : [
    "enabled",
    "hostname",
    "port",
    "tenant",
    "redirectURL"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "enabled": true,
  "hostname": "vidm.example.com",
  "port": 443,
  "tenant": "vIDMTenant",
  "redirectURL": "loginsight.example.com"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Failed to process request."
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

post /vidm

Configures vIDM integration.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "enabled": {
      "type": "boolean"
    },
    "hostname": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "port": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "tenant": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "redirectURL": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "username": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "password": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "enabled",
    "hostname",
    "redirectURL",
    "username",
    "password"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "enabled": true,
  "hostname": "vidm.example.com",
  "port": 443,
  "tenant": "vIDMTenant",
  "redirectURL": "loginsight.example.com",
  "username": "vIDMAdmin",
  "password": "vIDMPassword"
}

HTTP status code 200

HTTP response code 200 indicates that connection was made successfully.

HTTP status code 400

The request failed because the request body either did not contain valid JSON, did not match the required JSON format, or provided vIDM credentials are wrong.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Invalid request body.",
  "errorCode": "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "reason": "..."
  }
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 403

Indicates one of 2 possible cases; vIDM provided untrusted CA certificate and SSL connection was unsuccessful, or the requested action is not permitted for requesting user.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Requested action is forbidden for the requesting user.",
  "errorCode": "VIDM_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "errorCode":"com.vmware.loginsight.api.providers.vidm.forbidden_for_user"
  }
}

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that LI was not able to connect to specified vIDM instance.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Recieved unexpected response from the specified vIDM instance.",
  "errorCode": "VIDM_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "errorCode":"com.vmware.loginsight.api.providers.vidm.unexpected_response"
  }
}

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

HTTP status code 500

Internal error while processing the client request

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "errorMessage"
  ]
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Failed to process request."
}

HTTP status code 504

This response specifies that LI was unable to get timely and valid response from vIDM.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Recieved unexpected response from the specified vIDM instance.",
  "errorCode": "VIDM_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "errorCode":"com.vmware.loginsight.api.providers.vidm.unexpected_response"
  }
}

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/vidm/test post

post

Tests a connection with the specified vIDM instance with specified credentials.

post /vidm/test

Tests a connection with the specified vIDM instance with specified credentials.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "hostname": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "port": {
      "type": "integer"
    },
    "tenant": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "username": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "password": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required" : [
    "hostname",
    "username",
    "password"
   ]
}

Example:

{
  "enabled": true,
  "hostname": "vidm.example.com",
  "port": 443,
  "tenant": "vIDMTenant",
  "redirectURL": "loginsight.example.com",
  "username": "vIDMAdmin",
  "password": "vIDMPassword"
}

HTTP status code 200

HTTP response code 200 indicates that connection was made successfully.

HTTP status code 400

The request failed because the request body either did not contain valid JSON, did not match the required JSON format, or provided vIDM credentials are wrong.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Invalid request body.",
  "errorCode": "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "reason": "..."
  }
}

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Type: text/plain

Example:

HTTP status code 403

Indicates one of 2 possible cases; vIDM provided untrusted CA certificate and SSL connection was unsuccessful, or the requested action is not permitted for requesting user.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "id": "#error",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "errorMessage": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "errorCode": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": [
        "FIELD_ERROR",
        "TEST_ERROR",
        "JSON_FORMAT_ERROR",
        "LICENSE_ERROR",
        "VSPHERE_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "VROPS_INTEGRATION_ERROR",
        "UPGRADE_ERROR",
        "SEARCH_ERROR",
        "AGENT_ERROR",
        "RBAC_COMMON_ERROR",
        "RBAC_USERS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_ADGROUPS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_DATASETS_ERROR",
        "RBAC_VIDM_GROUPS_ERROR",
        "SECURITY_ERROR",
        "DEPLOYMENT_ERROR",
        "SUPPORT_BUNDLE_ERROR",
        "LOAD_BALANCER_ERROR",
        "VIDM_ERROR",
        "QUERY_ERROR"
      ]
    },
    "errorDetails": {
      "id": "#errorDetailsName",
      "properties": {
        "errorCode": {
          "type": "string"
        },
        "reason": {
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "anyOf":[
        {"required" : ["errorCode"]},
        {"required" : ["reason"]}
      ]
    }
  }
}

Example:

{
  "errorMessage": "Requested action is forbidden for the requesting user.",
  "errorCode": "VIDM_ERROR",
  "errorDetails": {
    "errorCode":"com.vmware.loginsight.api.providers.vidm.forbidden_for_user"
  }

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/vidm/status get

get

Gets the current state of connection with vIDM.

get /vidm/status

Gets the current state of connection with vIDM.

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

HTTP response code 200 indicates that connection was made successfully.

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema",
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "state": {
      "enum": [
        "CONNECTED",
        "DISCONNECTED",
        "UNCONFIGURED"
      ]
    }
  },
  "required": ["state"]
}

Example:

{
  "state":"CONNECTED"
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Example:

Secured by Bearer

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Example:

TODO: add a description

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • overwrite: (boolean - default: false)

    TODO: add a description

  • installAlerts: (boolean - default: false)

    TODO: add a description

Body

Type: application/json

Schema:

{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema"
}

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

/vropspacks/{vropsPackNamespace} get delete

get

get /vropspacks/{vropsPackNamespace}

Secured by Bearer

Authenticated requests must include an Authorization header with a session ID that was retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The session ID has a limited lifespan. Access is allowed only to resources that the user is authorized to use.

  • Response

URI Parameters

  • vropsPackNamespace: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

TODO: add a description

Headers

  • VMware-LI-API-Status: (string)

    Indicates the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    VMware-LI-API-Status: Tech Preview
  • Warning: (string)

    Additional information about the life-cycle status of the API.

    Example:

    Warning: 299 - "Tech Preview: This API is a tech-preview." "Tue,29 Mar 2016 21:56:46 GMT"

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.

Obtain a new session ID and retry the request, or make an unauthenticated request without the Authorization header.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Invalid session ID

HTTP status code 440

The request was refused because the session ID has expired. Obtain a new session ID from /api/v1/sessions.

Body

Type: text/plain

Example:

Login Timeout

Secured by Bearer

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    The word Bearer followed by a single space and a session ID retrieved from /api/v1/sessions. The bearer token is an opaque string and should be sent as-is.

    Example:

    Authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678901234567890

HTTP status code 401

The request was refused because it lacks valid authentication credentials. This can happen if the Authorization header was missing, or if it contained an invalid session ID.
